intro: Antidesma fuscocinereum, commonly known as the black-fruited antidesma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns dark when mature, often attracting birds and other wildlife. Antidesma fuscocinereum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
